alert.note: Alert for Knox; Laurel; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 2:29PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Laurel, northwestern Knox and north central Whitley Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 229 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Faber, or 8 miles north of Williamsburg, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Moore Hill and North Corbin around 235 PM EDT. Wilton around 240 PM EDT. Indian Creek, Rossland, Bertha Station, Gray, Permon, Lynn Camp and McHargue around 245 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Arkle, Dishman Springs, Swan Lake, Lowell, Emmanuel, Baileys Switch, Bentley Station, Garrich, Swanpond, Tuttle, Barbourville, Cannon, Heidrick, Jarvis, Boone Heights, Cranes Nest, Knoxfork, Artemus, Brush Creek and Gibbs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
